page.title: 18WITHINGTON
page.content: WITHINGTON IS A SMALL PEACEFUL VILLAGE SET IN BEAUTIFUL COUNTRYSIDE. SOME PARTS OF IT ARE VERY OLD DATING BACK TO 1600. THE VILLAGE IS STILL GROWING AND A SMALL DEVELOPMENT OF HOUSES IS PRESENTLY UNDER CONSTRUCTION. IT IS THE SMALLER OF THE TWO VILLAGES IN OUR AREA.IT HAS A PUBLIC HOUSE CALLED THE HARE AND HOUNDS. THERE IS A CHURCH CALLED ST JOHN THE BAPTIST. THERE HAS BEEN A CHURCH HERE SINCE BEFORE THE TIME OF THE ORIGINAL DOMESDAY BOOK. THE PRESENT CHURCH WAS ALTERED IN 1874. IT IS BUILT OF RED SANDSTONE. IT HAS A TALL BELL TOWER WITH A CLOCK ON IT. INSIDE THE CHURCH ARE SOME LOVELY BRASSES AND STAINED GLASS WINDOWS. THE CHURCH GRAVE YARD IS STILL IN USE. THERE IS A CHURCH HALL BUT IS IS NOT ATTACHED TO THE CHURCH. IT IS A SMALL CORRUGATED BUILDING. THERE IS NO LONGER A SHOP NOR IS THERE A SCHOOL.
